intro: Tragia luzoniensis, commonly known as the Luzon tragia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and often have a rough texture. Tragia luzoniensis is typically found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadside areas and forest edges.
